getChars(int, int, char[], int).Description: Exactly like String.getChars(): copy chars start through end - 1 from this CharSequence into dest beginning at offset destoff.
getChars(int, int, char[], int).FullName: public abstract void getChars (int start, int end, char[] dest, int destoff)

getChars(int,int,char[],int).Description: Exactly like String.getChars(): copy chars start through end - 1 from this CharSequence into dest beginning at offset destoff.
getChars(int,int,char[],int).FullName: public abstract void getChars (int start, int end, char[] dest, int destoff)

ClassDesc: Please implement this interface if your CharSequence has a getChars() method like the one in String that is faster than calling charAt() multiple times.
